reviewText: This Lifetime movie is about a young woman named Claire (Jennifer Grey).  Clare is looking forward to marrying her multimillionaire fiance;, Lorenzo in Apen.  Claire has a difficult time getting to Apen for her wedding.  She hitches several rides to get to Apen.  Suddenly she meets a father, Wes (Clark Gregg) and his duaghter Hilly (Meghan Park) who is traveling to Vail to visit family.  At the beginning Claire and Wes do not get along so well.  Claire and Wes get along alot better when they get to know each other better.  When Wes, Hilly drives Claire to her fiance house Claire gets a Big Surprise from her future husband.  Do you think Claire will marry Lorenzo or will she get together with Wes and be a mother to Hilly? See for yourself. Watch the movie! I recommend the movie.  I hope everyone enjoys the movie just like me!

reviewText: This movie borrows heavily from the tradition of movies like Planes, Trains and Automobiles or The Sure Things in that it is a movie in which a series of unlikely mishaps and weather conditions leads to the main character having a prolonged road trip in an attempt to reach a destination. In this case, a successful woman from Chicago is attempting to join her fiancee in Colorado for their Christmas eve wedding. Due to a mechanical problem on the plane and the busy travel season, she ends up on a bus and then a truck before being picked up by a school teacher widower and his daughter who also happen to be going to Colorado. At first they seem to be opposites and her big city ways clash with his love of hitting the backroads. However, by the time they reach his mother's house, they are warming to each other. Once she finds out he is more sophisticated than first met the eye and that her fiancee isn't what he appeared to be, the eventual ending is clear. This is a nice love story. All of the characters have a lot of chemistry and are likable. It is not terribly innovative or full of surprises, but except for a somewhat less-than-savory revelation about the girl's fiancee at the end, it is a comfortable movie to watch.
summary: No new ideas but a likable story nonetheless.

They give Claire a ride when she is left at a truck stop and the bickering begins...This is just a fun movie to watch with a bit of a surprise toward the end!

reviewText: Simply fast forward to where the fiancee is bidding her beau goodbye, skipping all the modeling poses, and enjoy a funny road trip/family film.  Too much has already been said about how movie makers increase the palatability of their entertainment by attracting all audiences - turning what would be excellent experiences into rejected products - so I won't dwell on that aspect.  But if you have a copy of this, just skip the first four minutes or so and let the rest of the movie run its course.The four main actors are quite convincing: the widowed father who considers himself cool yet practical; the daughter who allows herself to be in the company of older relatives without being mindlessly disrespectful; the grandma who serves "flesh" for dinner without apology; and the fiancee whose life is entirely reversed in less than a week. I even bought a pound of Folger's as a gift to a friend who watched the movie and loved it as well - with the omission of the first few minutes - as a reminder of the well-acted restaurant/motel scenes.This is not a children's film for Christmas, but older family members will enjoy it.Wish there were a way to order specific deletions from various films before ordering, like having the cheese taken off the Whopper or the pickles off the Chick fil a classic.

reviewText: When the Xmas dvds come out of storage....usually right after Thanksgiving....this one is a must-see!  The fact that the main actors are married in real life just seem to make this movie even more endearing to me.  Some times I don't want to know these facts...but in this case it worked for me.  What starts out as the roadtrip from Hell for Jennifer Grey....was side-tracked by meeting a somewhat "rough around the edges" guy and his teenage daughter headed for holidays with his mother.... the rough guy as Grey finds out is not so rough after all....but a gifted artist.  So sit down with the entire family and enjoy a funny...endearing...love story...at a great time of year.  donna

reviewText: She's cosmopolitan. He wears flannel. She's pampered. He's down-to-earth. It was never gonna start well. ROAD TO CHRISTMAS is strewn with predictable scenarios and conflicts. It's a 2006 holiday romantic comedy and a road picture. I do recommend it but with the caveat that you check out the other reviews. This isn't as family movie as some folks would prefer it to be, all because of one scene near the end. That scene actually had me busting out laughing. My two cents: I do think it is a bit inappropriate, given that ROAD TO CHRISTMAS seems to be promoted as one of them generic, uncontroversial Christmas family flicks. If I'd been watching this with my nieces or nephews, oboy, it would've gotten awkward and then I would've had to fend off their questions with an impromptu trip to Chucky Cheese.Claire Jameson (Jennifer Grey, DIRTY DANCING) has got it all. She has a thriving career as a fashion photographer. She's a bride-to-be, due to tie the knot in Aspen, Colorado on Christmas eve, only a few days away. Her Italian fiancé, Lorenzo, is a thoughtful, wealthy hunk, never mind that everyone seems to be broaching that stereotype about Italian men being these raucous, philandering gents. Claire is besotted with Lorenzo. When her photo shoot in Chicago is cancelled, she decides to surprise him with an early arrival in Aspen. She catches a flight.Meanwhile, widower Tom Pullman (Clark Gregg a.k.a. S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent Phil Coulson) and his 13-year-old daughter Hilly (Megan Park) embark on their annual holiday road trip to Grandma's, from Chicago to Vail, Colorado. This would make a neat drinking game: take a shot each time the Pullman truck suffers some sort of mishap. And for those keeping tabs, Tom is the one who wears flannel. And Claire who's pampered.It'll be a horrible trek for Claire Jameson. First, she has to endure sitting in coach for her flight (oh no!). And when inclement weather forces her plane to make an unscheduled stop, she gets on a bus and ends up next to an old bum. The next leg of her journey finds her hitching a ride with a bunch of creepy woodsy hunters who end up throwing her luggage out the van. At this stage Claire meets Tom and Hilly Pullman. Despite that Tom wears flannel, she rides along in their truck. She and Tom are soon sniping at each other. Lorenzo never stood a chance.I liked ROAD TO CHRISTMAS, mostly because of the three lead actors. Gregg and Grey - who are married in real life - go about their romance in fairly realistic fashion, given that the premise partly echoes that of PLANES, TRAINS, AND AUTOMOBILES. Megan Park, then a 20-year-old actress, looks convincing and is terrific as the 12- or 13-year-old daughter. Happily, the interactions among these three and the emotional connections made don't come off as too contrived, and that the comedy bits aren't too silly. I'm usually not into Lifetime TV movies, but I do count ROAD TO CHRISTMAS as worth your time.
summary: 3 (out of 5) thumbs up for this hitchhiking holiday road movie

reviewText: Instantly became one of my favorites. Why? reviewText: I was always a Jennifer Grey fan because of "Dirty Dancing" but this movie started out in a fairly cheesy holiday movie way and it seemed pretty good with no cursing or unusual creepy subject matter.  But I don't understand why they would put that weird shocker in the end after a really, warm, sappy feel-good story.  And I sort of saw this coming when I noticed the outwardly gay assistant staring at her fiance' (Lorenzo) in the beginning of the movie but it kind of took away from the whole heterosexual attraction that she felt with the guy in the truck, definitely was a let down.  I wouldn't recommend this movie especially if you have young children.  First, her fiance was lying to her about his sexual orientation and then they act like its no big thing that the young daughter saw two men in bed together (even if it was another woman, they could have had the person come out of the bedroom with a robe on, not much better, but would be more tastefully done since it would have alluded to an affair).  This truly did a disservice to Jennifer Grey's acting ability.
summary: The movie is not for family, but I liked the actors

reviewText: Umm . . . shallow but nice woman is headed to Colorado to marry her Italian fiance only to have transportation troubles on the way. She has to change transportation means several times until she hitches a ride with a man and his daughter.Umm . . . started out a cute movie. . . but too PC to enjoy. You have the old grandma on the plane who is supposed to be promiscuous to destroy the sweet grandma image. You have the gay couple. You have the artistic woodsy manly man. You have the vegetarians. You have . . . well you get the idea. Also the main character man looks the part but is too fem and too weak to be a masculine leading man character that he is supposed to be. I mean he is cute and looks kinda rugged in his make believe clothes and truck but when he opens his mouth . . . he shatters the facade. He also comes across as just . . . umm . . . bitchy . . . instead of gruff and tough. . . a man. He has no chemistry with the daughter in delivering his lines to pull off the part. Jennifer Grey is supposed to be the "I have no preconceived notions of anyone as I am so open minded but shallow as Paris Hilton and just as fake and pretentious as Legally Blonde's main character" . . . but she can't really pull that off. She comes across as nice. Too nice. And she doesn't really step into the air head domain to pull that off either. I will say that the movie moves at a nice normal slow pace. Not a lot of music to set the mood . . . you are left with the actors to do that etc which is good . . . a break from the Hollywood fiction. Anyway the ending was kinda a stretch. Who kisses another man on the eve of getting to their fiance to get married the day after that? Who kisses a man she knows nothing about? If we all made out with people we had to hang around a few minutes here and there there would be no relationships and marriages. Just ridiculous. Who walks in on their fiance with another man in his bed and then goes back in the house to talk? No one. You would be so repulsed and so disgusted and shocked you would flee. Who would run off and leave the "woman I love" after witnessing that? No one. Anyway there really isn't much to this movie. It is supposed to be a modern version of a many times over told story whether it is Christmas or not. Other than a pagan Christmas tree there is no mention of the reason for the season--Christ. You see a nativity scene and there is a faint Christmas Carol in the background (one of the few times music is heard in this) . . . but that is it. You would think from this movie Christmas is just another holiday.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This story had huge potential.  The relationship between the father and daughter was wonderful, the romance totally worked, and the progress the three characters made on their shared journey was believable and sweet.  However, this movie ended with disaster!  Seriously, if you want to kill an existing relationship and make way for a better one, there are far better ways to move the plot along~  And, the reaction of the leading lady to her devastating betrayal was seriously minimized.  Whoever created this story took talent and a good creation and flushed them down the toilet just to be sensationalistic.  Please, do not waste your time!
